discoveredAssets: localhost:80 - Flask/Werkzeug Python web application - HTTP authentication-based application with SOAP web services
http://localhost:80/ - Login page (POST /login) - Authentication entry point
http://localhost:80/login - POST endpoint accepting username/password parameters - Form-based authentication
http://localhost:80/logout - Logout handler (302 redirect to /login) - Session termination
http://localhost:80/dashboard - Protected dashboard (redirects to /login) - Authenticated user interface with SOAP service interaction
http://localhost:80/wsdl - SOAP Web Services Description Language endpoint (application/xml) - Accessible without authentication
http://localhost:80/static/style.css - Static stylesheet (200 OK) - References to account operations and SOAP displays
Werkzeug Debugger with EVALEX enabled (RCE) - Triggered on errors (POST /login without parameters) - Reveals stack traces, file paths, and debugger secret

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass (SQL injection, NoSQL injection, bypass via special characters, form tampering), weak password policy, credential enumeration, account lockout bypass, session management flaws, and CSRF protection
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint. Valid entry point for attacker access. Must validate all credential validation mechanisms and bypass techniques.

targets.objective: Test authorization flaws after authentication (privilege escalation, IDOR, access control), business logic flaws, SOAP service interaction through authenticated UI, and session management
targets.rationale: Protected dashboard accessible after authentication. Likely contains sensitive operations and account management. Test for horizontal/vertical privilege escalation.

targets.objective: Analyze WSDL for SOAP vulnerabilities (XXE injection, SOAP injection, XML bomb, WS-Security bypass, SOAP deserialization flaws), extract SOAP operations and test each for injection/bypass
targets.rationale: SOAP web service endpoint. Potential for XXE, injection attacks, and service manipulation. WSDL may reveal internal service operations.

targets.objective: Test session termination (session fixation, session reuse after logout, cache poisoning), CSRF on logout functionality
targets.rationale: Logout endpoint may have session management flaws allowing session replay or fixation attacks.

targets.objective: Exploit Werkzeug debugger with EVALEX enabled for remote code execution using exposed debugger secret (ZAw5DhoV3YIbKa7HeVE6), test debugger resource access (?__debugger__=yes), and achieve system compromise
targets.rationale: CRITICAL RCE VULNERABILITY. Debugger is enabled with EVALEX=true and secret is exposed in error pages. This allows arbitrary Python code execution with full system compromise capability. Primary exploitation target.

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure via error pages, test all HTTP methods, test for directory traversal (/login/../login works), test for URL encoding bypass (/login%2f variations), and probe for hidden endpoints
targets.rationale: Root path serves login page. May expose sensitive information in error responses. Path normalization issues detected (../ and %2f work).

targets.objective: Test for path traversal vulnerability (confirm /../ and %2f normalization), attempt to access /etc/passwd via traversal, enumerate file paths revealed in debugger traces (/home/daytona/.local/lib/python3.13/), and test for static file access control
targets.rationale: Path normalization vulnerabilities confirmed (/login/../login returns 200). Combined with debugger info leaks, may allow access to sensitive files. File paths from debugger traces may be accessible.

targets.objective: After extracting SOAP WSDL, test each operation for injection vulnerabilities (XML injection, SOAP injection, XXE), test for authentication bypass on SOAP operations, and test for business logic flaws in account/transfer operations
targets.rationale: SOAP services likely implement financial operations (account info, transfers). Typical targets for injection attacks and business logic exploitation. WSDL currently returns empty content but may become accessible or parseable through other means.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Werkzeug debugger enabled in production with EVALEX=true (arbitrary code execution capability)
[CRITICAL] Debugger secret exposed in error page HTML: SECRET = 'ZAw5DhoV3YIbKa7HeVE6'
[CRITICAL] Error pages expose full Python stack traces, file paths (/home/daytona/.local/lib/...), and framework internals
[HIGH] SOAP web service implementation with WSDL endpoint accessible without authentication
[HIGH] Path traversal working: /login/../login returns 200 (requests are being normalized)
[HIGH] URL-encoded slash (%2f) accepted: /%2flogin returns 200, bypasses some filters
[MEDIUM] Authentication endpoint responds with specific error messages ('Invalid credentials') potentially useful for enumeration
[MEDIUM] Double slash normalization accepted: //login returns 200 (may bypass rate limiting or WAF)
[LOW] CSS file references suggest account management, SOAP result display, and financial operations functionality
[INFO] Application stack: Python 3.13.3, Flask (Werkzeug 3.1.3), running on localhost port 80
